title: [K-12] Human-Centered Engineering Design Project-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental principles of engineering design and understanding of elementary education settings
context.additional_context: Experiencing human-centered design processes through community-linked or classroom-based projects, conceptualizing and articulating the design process through reflective practice activities

learning_goals: Learners select one real-world elementary education issue (e.g., classroom space constraints, tool accessibility), apply the 5-stage human-centered design process (observe-empathize-ideate-prototype-test), and achieve "excellent" ratings in ≥2 of 3 evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, user-friendliness) via peer/teacher assessments.

Learners write ≥3 design journals over six months, participate in 2 peer feedback sessions, and propose improvement directions meeting ≥2 of 3 teacher rubric criteria (clarity, creativity, feasibility).

Learners analyze 3 community partnership and 3 non-partnership cases in primary/secondary education, compare their HCD (Human-Centered Design) processes (empathize-define-ideate-prototype-test), and submit a report evaluating strengths/weaknesses per rubric standards (clarity, logical coherence, evidence).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
